main.docTitle: Maximum Scale of Election Expenses (Rural Committees) Order 1995

editorialNote.content: This Order was originally made under the Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance (Cap. 288). Though that Ordinance was repealed, this Order continues in force so far as it is not inconsistent with the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554) and has the effect for all purposes as if made under Cap. 554. (See section 48 of Cap. 554)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Maximum scale of election expenses
section.content: For the purposes of section 13(1) of the Ordinance*, the maximum scale of election expenses which may be incurred by or on behalf of a candidate in respect of the election of a Chairman, Vice-chairman or Executive Committee member of a Rural Committee is prescribed to be $30,000.

tr.td: “Ordinance” refers to the repealed Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance (Cap. 288).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Limitation of expenses for multiple elections
section.content: Where a person is a candidate for election for more than one office in a Rural Committee the total maximum scale of election expenses in respect of those offices shall be $30,000.
